etymologies: early 16th century: apparently from an alteration of Old English hefeld (see heald)

definitions: one of a set of looped wires or cords in a loom, with an eye in the center through which a warp yarn is passed before going through the reed to control its movement and divide the threads.
shortDefinitions: looped wire or cord with eye in centre through which warp yarn is passed in loom before going through reed
